bug.author: gracechristina
bug.summary: Errors when creating custom image for Jupyter notebooks
bug.description:
Hi, I followed the guide to create custom Jupyter Image <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/notebooks/custom-notebook/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/notebooks/custom-notebook/</denchmark-link>
It creates new server successfully, however when I connect, it will give me this error Sorry, /notebook/kubeflow/testcustomimage is not a valid page Anyone knows how to fix this or what did I do wrong? Thank you.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.57. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zabbasi>@zabbasi</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zabbasi>@zabbasi</denchmark-link> can you take a look please?
Can you share the source for your Dockerfile?

Hi, This is Dockerfile that I used. I used the default docker image as base image and install pandas on top of it. But when I choose this image, I am not able to connect to the pod. <denchmark-code>FROM gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tensorflow-2.0.0a-notebook-cpu:v0.5.0 RUN pip install pandas
ENV NB_PREFIX / CMD ["sh","-c", "jupyter notebook --notebook-dir=/home/jovyan --ip=0.0.0.0 --no-browser --allow-root --port=8888 --NotebookApp.token='' --NotebookApp.password='' --NotebookApp.allow_origin='*' --NotebookApp.base_url=${NB_PREFIX}"] </denchmark-code>

Sorry, I don't think it is the problem of the custom image. I restarted the ambassador pods and somehow the problem is solved and I can connect to the jupyter notebooks built with custom docker image. I am not sure whether this is a problem related to ambassador because I cannot replicate it anymore. If I encounter this again in the future, I will update this issue. Thank you.
